apiParam.apiDesc: The name of the topic, for example, "sports".
The name of the topic, for example "sports".

apiValue.shortdesc: The FCM token is used to identify this device so that FCM can send notifications to it.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The FCM token is used to identify this device so that FCM can send notifications to it. It is associated with your APNS token when the APNS token is supplied, so that sending messages to the FCM token will be delivered over APNS.
The FCM token is sometimes refreshed automatically. In your FIRMessaging delegate, the delegate method `messaging:didReceiveRegistrationToken:` will be called once a token is available, or has been refreshed. Typically it should be called once per app start, but may be called more often, if token is invalidated or updated.
Once you have an FCM token, you should send it to your application server, so it can use the FCM token to send notifications to your device.
The id of the channel. Must be unique per package. The value may be truncated if it is too long.

apiValue.shortdesc: The user visible name of the channel.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The user visible name of the channel. The recommended maximum length is 40 characters; the value may be truncated if it is too long.

apiValue.shortdesc: When set to true, Firebase Messaging will automatically establish a socket-based, direct channel to the FCM server.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: When set to true, Firebase Messaging will automatically establish a socket-based, direct channel to the FCM server. Enable this only if you are sending upstream messages or receiving non-APNS, data-only messages in foregrounded apps. Default is false.
